abstract: No automaker got a passing grade on all its light trucks in a test administered by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety.
snippet: No automaker got a passing grade on all its light trucks in a test administered by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT, July 2 — More than 60 percent of light trucks tested by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety have been found to provide inadequate protection against neck injuries in a rear-end crash, the most common type of accident.

headline.main: In Rear-End Crash Test, Most Trucks Fail to Stop Neck Injury
headline.print_headline: In Rear-End Crash Test, Most Trucks Fail to Stop Neck Injury

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Utility Vehicles and Other Light Trucks

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Chevrolet Division of General Motors Corp
